body_html:
TensorFlow mobile runs on Android and iOS and does support training as well. One way you could do this is to create the model using the Python libraries and then load and train it on Android, using the C++ APIs.

Here's a blog that does something similar (although not on mobile).

In the future TensorFlow Lite will also support training.
body_text:
TensorFlow mobile runs on Android and iOS and does support training as well. One way you could do this is to create the model using the Python libraries and then load and train it on Android, using the C++ APIs.
Here's a blog that does something similar (although not on mobile).
In the future TensorFlow Lite will also support training.
body:
[TensorFlow mobile](https://www.tensorflow.org/mobile/mobile_intro) runs on Android and iOS and does support training as well. One way you could do this is to create the model using the Python libraries and then load and train it on Android, using the C++ APIs.

Here's [a blog](https://tebesu.github.io/posts/Training-a-TensorFlow-graph-in-C++-API) that does something similar (although not on mobile). 

In the future [TensorFlow Lite](https://www.tensorflow.org/mobile/tflite/) will also support training.
